page.title: 13LOCAL HSTORY,NW NEWBURY
page.content: {MAIN HISTORICAL FEATURES}of area are ruins of{DONNINGTON CASTLE}and {SHAW {HOUSE.} {DONNINGTON CASTLE:}built in 1280 and crenellated in 1386 against a possible French invasion.Badly damaged by { {Cromwell's}troops in{Civil War}and has since become a ruin,with the Gatehouse towers the only part still standing. The name{'Donnington'}derives from the Saxon term meaning{'Fort on a Hill'. {SECOND BATTLE OF NEWBURY}fought in area in 1644 when Cromwell's troops met{Royalists}in battle in vicinity of Castle and at{Speen. {SHAW HOUSE,}now a comprehensive school,built by Tudor Woolmerchant, {Thomas Dolman. Charles 1st}lodged there during Civil War as did other Royalty during 17th Cent.In 1703,{ {Queen Anne}knighted the owner,{Sir {Thomas Dolman}for services to Crown.
